title: Robust US Jobs Report Brings October Surprise
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economics reporter Reade Pickert takes a look at the surprising jobs figures released this morning. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: US Expels Two Russian Embassy Officials From Washington
description: The US expelled two Russian diplomats, weeks after Moscow ordered two Americans to leave, the latest tit-for-tat expulsions as relations continue to worsen between the two countries.

title: The Key Nuclear Secrets Trump Allegedly Leaked
description: Former President Donald Trump has repeatedly been accused of leaking US secrets, but the latest allegations against him involve key details about some of the most sensitive weapons in the US nuclear arsenal.

title: G-7 Plans to Ask AI Companies to Agree to Watermarks, Audits
description: The Group of Seven nations are preparing to ask tech companies to agree to a set of rules to mitigate the risks of artificial intelligence systems as part of a proposal aimed at uniting the divided approaches in Europe and the US.

title: The Third Rail of EU Politics Is Threatening to Wreck All the Bloc’s Plans
description: The European Union’s longstanding failure to agree on how to deal with migration threatens to disrupt the rest of its business.

title: Biden Says Xi Meeting a ‘Possibility’ But Nothing Scheduled
description: President Joe Biden said he would potentially meet with Chinese President Xi Jinping at next month’s Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit but that no sit-down is scheduled.

title: ECB Policymakers Attack Euro Area’s Big-Spending Governments
description: Euro-area governments are choosing not to pursue budgetary policies that support the European Central Bank’s efforts to tame inflation, according to Governing Council member Klaas Knot.

title: Republican US House Speaker Candidates Scalise, Jordan to Debate on Fox
description: The major candidates to succeed Kevin McCarthy as US House Speaker will debate Monday on Fox News, an unusually public forum for campaigning in a party leadership election in which only members of Congress vote, a person familiar with plans said.

title: UK Weighs Boost to Electric Car Fund to Lure Green Investment
description: The UK is considering plowing hundreds of millions of pounds more into its electric-car subsidy fund, people familiar with the matter said, as part of the government’s response to US President Joe Biden’s package of green subsidies.

title: Venezuela Court Orders Extradition of Exiled Opposition Leaders
description: Venezuela’s Supreme Court ordered the extradition of three exiled opposition leaders as the government intensifies its attacks on political dissent ahead of the 2024 presidential vote.

title: Sunak Stealth Raid Will Be Biggest UK Tax Rise Ever, Study Shows
description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s stealth tax raid on households is on course to be the biggest tax rise on record after being turbocharged by high inflation, new research showed.

title: Zelenskiy Aide Says Ukraine Needs More Air Defense Before Winter
description: Ukraine is seeking more air defense systems ahead of winter to protect its energy infrastructure from the type of Russian attacks that caused massive blackouts across the country last year, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy’s deputy chief of staff said.

title: City Giants Caught in Crossfire of Labour-Tory Business Battle
description: Britain’s Labour party has held back the launch of a new business council after senior Conservatives intervened with financial services companies that were due to take part.

title: When the Paris 2024 Olympics Threaten a French Institution
description: The booksellers that have lined the Seine for centuries and the city reach a detente over demands they relocate for the games.

title: Ivory Coast President Ouattara Removes PM, Dissolves Cabinet
description: Ivorian President Alassane Ouattara has removed his prime minister and dissolved his cabinet.

title: BMW’s Chinese EV Exports Are Target of EU Anti-Subsidy Probe
description: BMW AG has received a request for information from the European Union about its iX3 sport utility vehicle, which it exports from Chinese production facilities, as part of the bloc’s probe into Beijing’s subsidies for electric-vehicle makers.

title: Labour's Scottish Election Boost
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Canada Joins India-Hosted Parliamentary Summit Amid Tensions
description: Canada will join an India-hosted parliamentary speakers’ summit of Group of 20 nations, signaling both countries are keen to cooperate in legislative affairs despite tensions over the killing of a Sikh separatist leader.

title: BlackRock’s Fink Sees Echoes of 1980s Miracle in Japan
description: BlackRock Inc. CEO Larry Fink sees echoes of Japan’s 1980s “economic miracle” in the nation’s current efforts to transform its economy, he told a roundtable including Prime Minister Fumio Kishida on Friday.

title: Polish Election Race Tightens as Opposition Gains Before Vote
description: Poland’s pro-European Union opposition appears to have seized the momentum in the final stretch of an election campaign that’s due to culminate on Oct. 15.

title: Orban Lays Bare EU Split on Migration With Vitriol and Rancor
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban laid bare divisions within the European Union over how to deal with a renewed surge of asylum seekers, with an unusually violent comment before a meeting of the bloc’s leaders.

title: Meloni’s Budget Plans Worry German Ratings Company Scope
description: Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni’s plan to delay a return to the region’s budget deficit limits leaves Italy more exposed to the application of European Central Bank policy, Scope Ratings said.

title: France Blocks US Takeover of Nuclear Supplier as Macron Expands Reach
description: France has blocked the purchase of the French units of Canada’s Velan Inc. by US-based Flowserve Corp., effectively scuppering a deal between US and Canadian companies in the name of its own strategic autonomy.

title: Shifting Global Sands Bedevil US Foreign Policy
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: AMLO Shows He's Not Going Quietly With New Market Interventions
description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador chose the country’s private airports to send a punchy message to the business and political world: it may be his final year in office but he’s still very much in charge.

title: Iran’s Narges Mohammadi Awarded 2023 Nobel Peace Prize
description: Iranian human rights activist Narges Mohammadi was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for 2023.

title: Biden Administration Backs Strong Rules to Close Digital Divide
description: The Biden administration urged the Federal Communications Commission to adopt strong rules to redress historic shortfalls that have left some communities lacking adequate broadband service.

title: Yellen to Focus on World Bank and China at Global Meetings
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen is expected to push her reform agenda for the World Bank, meet with senior Chinese officials and may discuss new ways to limit Russia’s revenue from oil sales on a nine-day international trip set to start Sunday.

title: Ethiopia’s Peace Rally All But Gone as Default Possibility Grows
description: Ethiopia’s sole eurobond is close to erasing gains made since a peace process started to end its catastrophic civil war, as investors increase bets that the Horn of Africa nation will default.

title: Myanmar Top Court Rejects Aung San Suu Kyi’s Corruption Conviction Appeals
description: Myanmar’s Supreme Court rejected appeals by Aung San Suu Kyi’s lawyers to overturn her conviction in some corruption cases brought against the ousted leader by the military regime.

title: Ukraine Recap: Russian Missiles Hit Residential Area of Kharkiv
description: Russian forces struck a residential area of Kharkiv, Ukraine’s second largest city, with ballistic missiles Friday morning. “The body of a 10-year-old child was found under the ruins. Another 16 people were injured,” interior minister Igor Klymenko said in a statement as rescue efforts continue. The hit came less than 24 hours after more than 50 people were killed when a Russian rocket hit a cafe and grocery store in the village of Hroze near Kupyansk, to Kharkiv’s southeast, in one of the deadl

title: Eskom to Have a CEO by Year End, South Africa’s Gordhan Says
description: South Africa’s protracted search for Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd.’s new chief executive officer will end by December, according to Public Enterprises Minister Pravin Gordhan.

title: Trump Endorses Ohio’s Jim Jordan for House Speaker Over Scalise
description: Donald Trump endorsed Representative Jim Jordan as the next speaker of the US House of Representatives, giving the nine-term congressman from Ohio the former president’s coveted stamp of approval going into next week’s leadership elections.

title: EU, US Seek Interim Steel Deal to Avoid Return of Trump Tariffs
description: The leaders of the European Union and the US are seeking to announce an interim deal at an Oct. 20 summit on steel and aluminum trade that would avert the re-imposition of Trump-era tariffs on billions of dollars of transatlantic commerce.

title: Turkey Hits Kurd Militia in Syria After US Downs Its Armed Drone
description: Turkey conducted airstrikes on US-backed Kurdish militant groups in northern Syria after the US shot down an armed Turkish drone that flew too close to American ground forces  — in a rare instance of two NATO allies coming into open conflict with one another.

title: Labour Wins Scotland Seat in Key Test for Leader Keir Starmer
description: The UK’s main opposition Labour Party won a parliamentary election in Scotland, a significant boost for leader Keir Starmer as he prepares to use his party’s annual conference to show he’s on course to win power in a nationwide vote expected next year.

title: Trump Drops $500 Million Lawsuit Against Former Lawyer Cohen
description: Donald Trump gave up on the $500 million lawsuit he filed against his estranged former lawyer Michael Cohen, just four days before he was due to answer questions under oath in the case.

title: New Zealand’s Queenstown Airport Closed as Suspected Bomb Found
description: New Zealand’s Queenstown Airport has been cleared to reopen after it was closed for several hours on Friday while authorities investigated a suspected bomb.
